meanings.definition: A person who seizes or takes possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The brave seizor captured the flag in the game.
meanings.sent2: The police officer acted as the seizor of the stolen goods.
meanings.sent3: The young seizor playfully claimed the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her determination made her a seizor of opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The seizor's swift actions secured the valuable artifact.

meanings.definition: The act of seizing or taking possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The seizor of the treasure was quick and precise.
meanings.sent2: The seizor of power must be done with caution.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected seizor of the remote control caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: The seizor of time is a constant struggle for many.
meanings.sent5: The seizor of attention in the room was the charismatic speaker.
